DOC.HEAD: South Dakota Walleye Limit Reduced One-Third
DOC.TEXT: Anglers will find it easier to catch their limit of South Dakota walleye in 1990, but not because the finicky game fish is suddenly more willing to take the bait. The legal daily catch has been cut from six to four as of Monday, annoying fishermen and prompting warnings that tourism may suffer. The problem is that anglers are getting too good at catching the tasty fish. While fishermen once had to guess where the elusive and feisty walleyes were lurking, many now rely on electronic sonar units to locate them, said Dennis Unkenholz, a biologist for the Game, Fish and Parks Department. ``There's more people fishing more hours,'' Unkenholz said. ``They're using bigger boats and sophisticated fishing equipment.'' ``Walleyes are a renewable resource, but they can only sustain so much harvest,'' he added. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission made the unexpected cut Nov. 6 and reaffirmed its decision Dec. 8. The agency said that in some places, heavy fishing has caused a ``noticeable decline in the quality of the fishery and places the future of the fishery in serious jeopardy.'' Unkenholz said that the reduced limit won't affect many people because few anglers catch the limit anyway. South Dakota will see fewer non-resident anglers because of the change, said Larry Atkinson, chairman of the Tourism Advisory Board. Fishing contributes $70 million a year to South Dakota's economy, he said. ``It will have a severe impact on especially the businesses that are hanging on by a thread now,'' he said. Bait shops and campgrounds catering to anglers dot the shoreline along the four Missouri River reservoirs in South Dakota. Walleyes also are the main fare in natural lakes in eastern South Dakota. Since fishing licenses are not issued specifically for walleyes, it's not possible to say exactly how many people cast their lines for walleyes each year in South Dakota. The state record for walleyes is about 15 pounds, although most of those caught range between one-half pound and three pounds.
